chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Operate w/out Valid License - Cause Death

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Operate w/out Valid License - Cause Death

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Makeba L Wright

records.addlTxt: Case calendared for Projected Guilty Plea October 27, 2022.  Court in trial on another matter.  Parties agree via email to November 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 34, Judge Yamahiro in Room 423 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Makeba L Wright in court.  Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court for Makeba L Wright.  Attorney Ian F Vance-Curzan in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Scheduling Conference held.   Defense requests a Projected Guilty Plea date.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  bm

Defendant Makeba L Wright in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Scheduling Conference held.  Defense has received discovery, offer and requests a Scheduling Conference date.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  bm
Per ADA Vance-Curzan this matter should be assigned to Br. 12 Judge Borowski.

Defendant Makeba L Wright in court by video with Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz who appears in person.  Ian Vance-Curzan appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer M. Porter. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Makeba L Wright in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant Makeba L Wright in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Makeba L Wright appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge Franke, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
